title: Why a simple three pointer by Aussie NBA star Ben Simmons has EVERYONE talking
text:
Australian NBA star Ben Simmons has sent the basketball world into a frenzy after sinking the first three-pointer of his career.

The highest-paid Australian athlete ever and Philadelphia 76ers star has failed to score from beyond the arc since being drafted into the league in 2016.

But with seconds left in the first half of his side's preseason game against Chinese side Guanzhou Loon-Lions, the 23-year-old finally drained his first shot from deep.

His team led by 38 points at the time, but Simmons' teammates and fans inside Philadelphia's Wells Fargo Center erupted as if he won the game.

Speaking following his side's 144-86 victory, the Australian said the made three-pointer was simply the culmination of hard work.

'I work every day so it shows,' he said, according to The Australian.

'I'm in the gym every day putting in work so I feel like it's paying off.'

The successful three-pointer is a positive sign for those hoping the Melbourne-born point guard can take his game to the next level.

The 2.08m star was given a $242million contract extension by the Philadelphia 76ers in July.

In the first year of his new contract alone, he will make a staggering $42m.

Simmons did not play for the Australian national team in last month's World Cup, but has committed to the Boomer's Olympic campaign next year.

In August, he claimed he was racially profiled at Melbourne's Crown Casino.

A spokeswoman for Crown Casino responded by saying the group were allowed in, and denied the allegations made by Simmons.
description: The Philadelphia 76ers were dominating in a preseason game on Tuesday, but fans inside the area erupted as if he won the game when he hit a three at the end of the first half.
authors: Charlie Coë For Daily Mail Australia
